com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic
Class PreparedGoal

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.PreparedGoal

public class PreparedGoal
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows to prepare a goal for faster multiuse, also it gives possibility to make parametrized goals

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)

Constructor Detail

PreparedGoal

public PreparedGoal(Term goal,
                    ProlContext workContext)
A constructor allows to make the prepared goal on already parsed goal, of course without support any inside parametrized variables

Parameters:
goal - the parsed goal, must not be null
workContext - the work context for the goal, must not be null
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - it will be thrown if there is any null pointer at argument list

PreparedGoal

public PreparedGoal(Term goal,
                    ProlContext workContext,
                    TraceListener tracer)
A constructor allows to make the prepared goal on already parsed goal, of course without support any inside parametrized variables

Parameters:
goal - the parsed goal, must not be null
workContext - the work context for the goal, must not be null
tracer - the tracer for wrapped goal, can be null
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - it will be thrown if there is any null pointer at argument list

PreparedGoal

public PreparedGoal(java.lang.String goal,
                    ProlContext workContext)
             throws java.io.IOException
A constructor. You can insert {?} parameters inside the goal text and these parts will be changed to named inside vars, thus you will be able make parametrized versions of the Goal through special functions of the class. Be carefully in use of {?} strings they are used as macroses by the constructor.

Parameters:
goal - the goal text, mist not be null
workContext - the context which will be used for the goal, must not be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there is any exception during parsing
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the goal or the workContext (or both) is null
See Also:
ProlContext

PreparedGoal

public PreparedGoal(java.lang.String goal,
                    ProlContext workContext,
                    TraceListener tracer)
             throws java.io.IOException
A constructor. You can insert {?} parameters inside the goal text and these parts will be changed to named inside vars, thus you will be able make parametrized versions of the Goal through special functions of the class. Be carefully in use of {?} strings they are used as macroses by the constructor.

Parameters:
goal - the goal text, mist not be null
workContext - the context which will be used for the goal, must not be null
tracer - the tracer to be used for wrapped goal, can be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there is any exception during parsing
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the goal or the workContext (or both) is null
See Also:
ProlContext

getOrderedVars

protected final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOrderedVars()
Get the list of parametrized variable names, it is used for inside needs

Returns:
a list object containing ordered list of parametrized variables, will not be null

setOrderedVars

protected final void setOrderedVars(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
Set the list of parametrized var names, must not be null

Parameters:
list - a list containing ordered parametrized var names

getParsedGoal

public final Term getParsedGoal()
Get the term representing parsed goal

Returns:
a term pbject which containing a tree of parsed original goal text

getContext

public final ProlContext getContext()
Get the work context for the goal

Returns:
the work prol context for the goal, must not be null

getGoalAsText

public final java.lang.String getGoalAsText()
Get prepared (all {?} changed to inside var names) goal text

Returns:
the prepared goal text as String object, must not be null

processGoalOnce

public final Term processGoalOnce()
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Process the goal once. The goal will be called once and the result will be returned. If the goal fails then null will be returned.

Returns:
null if the goal fails else a resulting Term
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the executing thread is interrupted
See Also:
Goal

forIntegerParameters

public final Goal forIntegerParameters(int... parameters)
Make version of the goal for ordered integer parameters.

Parameters:
parameters - an integer array of values for inside goal parameters, must not be null
Returns:
the prepared goal for the parameters
See Also:
Goal

forParameters

public final Goal forParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Term> vars)
Make version of goal for named list of values

Parameters:
vars - a Map contains name-value pairs for inside parametrized variables, must not be null
Returns:
the prepared goal for the parameters

getNonparametrizedGoalInstance

public final Goal getNonparametrizedGoalInstance()
Get the goal instance without any parametrization

Returns:
the goal instance, must not be null
